description: The administration will soon sign a rare earth mineral deal with Ukraine, the president said.
title: Trump Signs Order to Ramp Up US Production of Critical Earth Minerals

description: Attorney General Pam Bondi 'has made immigration enforcement the highest priority' in the Justice Department, District Attorney Shawn Anderson says.
title: Chinese National Sentenced for Conspiracy to Transport Illegal Immigrants to Guam

description: The federal government will join New Brunswick and Nova Scotia in spending a total of $650 million on protecting the Chignecto Isthmus, the narrow strip of flood-prone land that links the two Maritime provinces. Ottawa announced Thursday it will contribute $325 million to the project, while the two provinces committed to spending $162.5 million each. […]
title: Ottawa Lands Chignecto Isthmus Deal With Nova Scotia and New Brunswick

description: A look into the world through the lens of photography.
title: Day in Photos: Storm Martinho in Portugal, Suspension Bridge Collapses in Ecuador, and Basalt Columns in Ireland

description: It's the first time the United States has sanctioned what is called a 'teapot refinery,' which mainly buys oil from Iran.
title: US Sanctions Entities Tied to Iran–China Petroleum Trade

description: For the eighth consecutive year, Finland has claimed the title of the world’s happiest country, according to the 2025 World Happiness Report released Thursday. Other Nordic nations—Denmark, Iceland, and Sweden—maintained their top spots as well, while the United States and the UK hit record lows. The happiness ratings were compiled by the Wellbeing Research Centre […]
title: Finland Tops World Happiness Rankings Once Again

description: NTD’s Lee Hall sits down with Charles Parton OBE, a former British diplomat who spent 22 years working in China. Parton says our politicians, academics, and business people need to be more aware of the threat posed by the Chinese Communist Party (CCP). He says the CCP sees science and technology as a key battleground […]
title: China’s Domination of Science and Technology Is a Danger to National Security: Charles Parton

description: A deal to send Canadian green hydrogen exports to Germany is awaiting Ottawa’s final decision on funding and a verdict from European regulators on whether the project has adequate competition. Canada and Germany made a big show of signing a hydrogen agreement in August 2022, and former prime minister Justin Trudeau and outgoing German Chancellor […]
title: Canada’s Deal to Export Hydrogen to Germany Awaits More Federal Funding Decisions

description: A major federal union says it’s worried about a plan to eliminate more than 300 positions at Canada’s Translation Bureau. In a news release, the Canadian Association of Professional Employees said it’s condemning a five-year business plan that would shrink the bureau’s workforce by almost 25 percent. The Translation Bureau is a federal service under […]
title: Federal Union Concerned About Planned Cuts to Translation Bureau

description: Iran's IRGC, which controls 'vast segments' of the country's economy and plays a role in the country’s politics, received support from four Chinese nationals.
title: US Seeks Tips to Disrupt China’s Tech Transfers to Iran, Offers $15 Million

description: Beijing intervenes the sale of the rights to operate the two parts of the Panama Canal, but there's not much it can do, an expert says.
title: Beijing Puts Its Thumb on Panama Canal Deal

description: Six teenagers have been charged in connection with an attempted robbery at a Toronto-area jewelry store, police say. The incident occurred on March 14 while York Regional Police officers were investigating the theft of an Acura TLX sedan in Vaughan, Ont., according to a March 19 press release. Police say six people were linked to […]
title: Six Teens Charged in Connection With Botched Toronto Jewelry Store Break-In

description: Gabriel Nadeau-Dubois, co-spokesperson of the left-wing Québec solidaire party who rose to prominence during the 2012 student strike, says he is stepping down from the party’s leadership team. He resigned today as co-spokesperson and House leader, and says he will stay on as a member of the legislature for his Montreal riding until the next […]
title: Ex-Student Activist Gabriel Nadeau-Dubois, With Québec Solidaire, to Leave Politics

description: The University of British Columbia (UBC) has banned China’s upstart artificial intelligence (AI) tool DeepSeek from the school’s devices and networks. The university said the decision to ban DeepSeek’s applications was based on a “high degree” of risk to privacy and security. “DeepSeek’s applications raise privacy and security concerns, particularly regarding extensive data collection and […]
title: Canadian University Bans Chinese AI DeepSeek From Devices, Networks Over Privacy and Security Concerns

description: Chinese tariffs on $3.7 billion of Canadian agricultural goods and food products took effect on March 20, several months after Canada imposed tariffs on Chinese electric vehicles (EVs) and metals. The Chinese tariffs were implemented shortly after midnight, imposing a 100 percent levy on Canadian imports of canola oil, oil cakes, and peas, along with […]
title: Chinese Tariffs on $3.7 Billion Worth of Canadian Goods Take Effect

description: The U.S.-China Economic and Security Review Commission (USCC) holds a hearing titled “Crossroads of Competition: China in Southeast Asia and the Pacific Islands” at 9:30 a.m. ET on March 20. 9:30 a.m. to 9:40 a.m.: Co-Chairs’ Opening Remarks 9:40 a.m. to 11:10 a.m.: Panel I: U.S.-China Strategic Competition in Southeast Asia and the Pacific Islands […]
title: REPLAY: USCC’s Hearing on the Competition With China in Southeast Asia and Pacific Islands

description: Gold’s rally may extend if central bank buying and ETF inflows remain strong, analysts predict.
title: Citi Raises Gold Price Target to $3,200 Amid Strong Demand and Fed Policy Signals

description: Conservative Leader Pierre Poilievre says he would establish certain zones that would have pre-approved permits for major construction and energy projects, in a bid to accelerate the development of key infrastructure and industries. “After years of uncertainty where businesses spent billions of dollars and many years getting to a ‘maybe,’ they will know that they […]
title: Poilievre Wants Pre-Approved Zones to Build Major Projects

description: The head of the Bank of Canada is signalling a shift in how the central bank sets its key interest rate as trade uncertainty with the United States makes long-term forecasting much more difficult. Tiff Macklem says that means monetary policymakers may be “acting quickly” when it comes to setting interest rates, rather than looking […]
title: Bank of Canada Signals Shift in How It Sets Rates Amid Tariff Uncertainty

description: The 27 nation bloc had planned to introduce its first round of tariffs on items such as American whiskey from the start of April.
title: EU Delays First Round of Counter Tariffs Until Mid-April

description: A group of 14 energy CEOs have written a letter to all major federal parties urging them to declare an “energy crisis” in Canada and use emergency powers to relax regulations within the industry and increase production levels. The CEOs, who represent the 10 largest oil and gas companies and four largest pipeline companies in […]
title: Energy CEOs Ask Party Leaders to Declare ‘Energy Crisis’, Reduce Oil and Gas Regulations

description: Hudson’s Bay’s proposed liquidation is still on hold as the company works to address its differences with landlords and other stakeholders after filing for creditor protection earlier this month. The department store chain that holds the title of Canada’s oldest company asked an Ontario court Monday for permission to close all 80 of its stores, […]
title: Hudson’s Bay Liquidation on Hold as Discussions Continue to Diffuse Differences

description: Environment Minister Terry Duguid says a Mark Carney government will maintain a cap on oil and gas production emissions. In an interview with The Canadian Press, Duguid says Canada wants the energy but not the pollution that comes with its production. The Liberals introduced draft regulations back in November that require producers to cut emissions […]
title: Mark Carney Will Maintain Oil and Gas Emissions Cap, Environment Minister Says

description: EDMONTON–The Alberta government is seeking to amend its critical infrastructure defence law to prevent federal workers from going to oil sector sites and collecting data. The bill comes at a time when the federal government is introducing regulations to cap emissions in the oil and gas sector. Alberta says this in effect amounts to a […]
title: New Alberta Bill Would Keep Federal Workers From Accessing Oil and Gas Emissions Data

description: Israel resumed its attack on Hamas on March 18 as cease-fire negotiations broke down, while the United States has stepped up pressure on Yemen's Houthi rebels.
title: Israelis Head for Shelters as Hamas, Houthis Renew Missile Attacks

description: The alert system of the plane that crashed at Toronto’s Pearson airport last month indicated a rapid descent rate less than three seconds before touchdown, a preliminary report into the crash has found. The Transportation Safety Board of Canada (TSB) issued its report on March 20 as part of its ongoing investigation into the Feb. […]
title: Early Investigation Into Toronto Delta Plane Crash Shows Plane Travelling at High Rate of Descent

description: Prime Minister Mark Carney is expected to call a federal election on Sunday for a vote as early as April 28. Sources would not confirm the specific date of the vote, but federal campaigns must run at least 37 days. This will be Canada’s 45th federal election. Canada’s political parties have been mobilizing campaigns by […]
title: PM Mark Carney Expected to Call Federal Election on Sunday

description: Some Canadian companies are considering a move to the United States as a strategy to evade tariffs and protect the future of their businesses, a new survey suggests. Nineteen percent of the 283 Canadian companies that participated in the survey indicated they would consider relocating part or all of their production to the United States […]
title: A Fifth of Canadian Companies Eye Relocation to the US Amid Tariff Concerns: Poll

description: Senior military figures from a variety of countries will meet just outside London on Thursday to discuss the plans moving into an 'operational phase.'
title: Britain to Host Talks on Peacekeeping in Ukraine

description: The European Union's leaders will discuss plans to mobilize hundreds of billions of euros to boost the military readiness of the bloc to fend off Russia.

description: The Quebec government will table new legislation today to strengthen secularism in the province’s schools. Education Minister Bernard Drainville says that religious accommodations have no place in Quebec schools, and that science, sex education and gender equality must be taught properly. The government is planning to update Quebec’s Education Act following a controversy over reports […]

description: Eight members of the bank’s nine-person Monetary Policy Committee voted to keep rates on hold.
title: UK Interest Rates Held at 4.5 Percent as Bank of England Warns Over US Tariff Uncertainty

description: Reform UK is on course to secure control of eight councils, with six of them currently under Conservative leadership.
title: Tories Face Test in May Local Elections Amid Reform Rise

description: Libby Mettam says she will not continue as WA Liberals leader after it became clear she lacked the support of party colleagues after another significant election defeat. The move opens the door for high-profile Perth Lord Mayor Basil Zempilas, who narrowly secured the seat of Churchlands at the recent election, to assume the leadership now […]

description: The pontiff has been hospitalized with pneumonia since February.

description: SANTO DOMINGO, Dominican Republic—Joshua Riibe, a senior at St. Cloud University in Minnesota who is believed to be the last person to see missing University of Pittsburgh student Sudiksha Konanki in the Dominican Republic, left the Caribbean country on Wednesday, his lawyers said. Following a trial exceeding five hours, Judge Edwin Rijo ruled Wednesday that […]
title: American Believed to Be Last Person to See Missing US Student Left the Dominican Republic

description: A jury says the environmental group defamed Energy Transfer during Dakota Access pipeline protests.

description: The outlet announced it will take legal action seeking to restore its federal funding.

description: The Coalition matched Labor's offer to reduce PBS medicine costs, with Mark Butler confirming changes would take effect from January 1.

description: The release of approximately 80,000 documents was met with skepticism by those looking for concrete evidence about the former president's 1963 assassination.

description: Police have scanned more than 4,000 people for knives and dangerous weapons using electronic metal detecting 'wands.'

description: Saskatchewan’s government has tabled its 2025–2026 budget with a surplus of $12.1 million, citing U.S. and China tariffs as points of concern. Finance Minister Jim Reiter delivered the budget on March 19, saying the threat of more tariffs from the United States presents a challenge. The government has opted to prioritize its affordability promises like […]

description: The Malaysian government has approved a fresh search for the wreckage of Malaysia Airlines flight MH370, more than a decade after its mysterious disappearance.
title: 10 Years On, Search for Flight MH370 to Resume
